description: Jesta will build a 30-story tower with 273 hotel keys and 345 apartments, including 18 workforce units, on 2.3 acres that front Biscayne Bay. The Kobi Karp-designed development will include 7,500 square feet of meeting space, 677 parking spaces and three restaurants. North Bay Village commissioners approved the project in January. Jesta paid $15 million for the property in 2016.

In October, Sunbeam Properties secured the final vote needed to build a taller 7.3 million-square-foot development on 13 acres it owns in North Bay Village. The phased project could include nearly 2,000 residential units with some workforce housing apartments; 112,500 square feet of hotel space with 300 hotel rooms; 870,000 square feet of office and retail space; public space that includes a baywalk; and about 5,000 parking spaces, and open space.

Shoma, led by Chairman Masoud Shojaee and President Stephanie Shojaee,  launched sales of the Shoma Bay condos, with prices starting in the $400,000s in September. Shoma Bay will be a 19-story mixed-use project with 327 condos on a 2.8-acre property. Units at Shoma Bay will start at 324-square-foot studios and go up to 1,435-square-foot three-bedroom condos. That means prices start at about $1,200 per square foot.

An affiliate of Macklowe Properties paid $47.7 million for the 3-acre Biscayne Sea Club co-op at 8000, 8010 and 8020 East Drive. Macklowe Properties, likely plans luxury condos on the Biscayne Sea Club site.

Pacific & Orient Properties plans a 21-story, 54-residence waterfront condominium along an 33,600-square-foot lot on the Intracoastal Waterway, where residences will have at least two bedrooms and two views of Biscayne Bay. The building, at 7918 West Drive, will have 15,224 square feet of common areas, 148 parking spaces and 34 storage units. The project broke ground in February and is expected to be completed by 2025 with an anticipated cost of $125 million, according to a spokesperson.
